text:
Nice museum on the heritage of Singapore General Hospital (SGH) and the medical profession in Singapore, housed in the historic Bowyer Block.

Fully air-conditioned with two levels to explore - the storyboards, artefacts and wax figures (on level 2) make it a nice self-guided experience.

The SGH museum in Singapore offers a glimpse into the world of surgical tools. While the display of the tools is interesting, unfortunately, there is a lack of information about how these tools are used. The museum would greatly benefit from providing more context and explanations to enhance the visitor's understanding. Overall, it is a small museum that could be improved with better interpretation and educational materials.

Just visited my staff at Block 4 and otw to the MRT station my visit to the Singapore General Hospital museum was an enriching experience. The meticulous curation unveiled a captivating journey through the historical instruments, offering profound insights into the early days of SGH. The exhibits not only showcased the evolution of medical tools but also painted a vivid picture of the hospital's humble beginnings. It was a journey that left me with a deep appreciation for the medical advancements and the dedicated individuals who shaped SGH's legacy. Do not miss it! #SGH #museum #SG #

We saw the building after having lunch at SGH and decided to go in. A quaint 2-storey mini museum about the history of SGH. I loved looking at the old surgical tools used back then. 4/5 stars because the mannequin at the stairs scared me as I was walking up lol.
Small museum but concise, it showcase how Singapore's healthcare started and where it is going
